  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static Author[]
    add(Author[] array, Author item)
    The add method is passed the array and an Author object
    1) A new Author array is created of length of the old array + 1
    2) The Authors from the old array are copied into the new array
    3) The new Author is added in the last index of the new array
    4) The new array is returned
    static Author[]
    fillArray(Scanner kb)
    The fillArray method
    1) Prompts for the number of authors and ensures it is greater than 0
    2) Creates an array of Author for the total number 3) reads the first, last name, publisher, and number of books 4) Builds an author object
    5) Puts that author object into the array
    6) When done filling the array returns the array
    static int
    menu(Scanner kb)
    The basic menu method provided by me
    static Author
    readAuthor(Scanner kb)
    The readAuthor method prompts the user for the first and last name the publisher and the nubmer of books.
    static Author[]
    remove(Author[] array, int index)
    The remove method is passed the array and an index
    1) If the index is -1 or the array length is 0 then the original array is returned
    2) A new Author array is created of length of the old array - 1
    2) The Authors from the old array are copied into the new array except for the index that is being removed
    4) The new array is returned

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • fillArray

      public static Author[] fillArray(Scanner kb)
      The fillArray method
      1) Prompts for the number of authors and ensures it is greater than 0
      2) Creates an array of Author for the total number 3) reads the first, last name, publisher, and number of books 4) Builds an author object
      5) Puts that author object into the array
      6) When done filling the array returns the array
      Parameters:
      kb - Representing the Scanner object
      Returns:
      Author array Representing the filled array
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null
      Post:
      The input buffer will be left empty

    • readAuthor

      public static Author readAuthor(Scanner kb)
      The readAuthor method prompts the user for the first and last name the publisher and the nubmer of books. If any of the strings are null or empty or the books is less than 1 the user is reprompted.
      Once all information has been read in and validated as not null or empty or less than 1 then an Author object is created and returned
      Parameters:
      kb - Representing the Scanner object
      Returns:
      Author Representing an Author object
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null
      Post:
      The input buffer is left clean

    • add

      public static Author[] add(Author[] array, Author item)
      The add method is passed the array and an Author object
      1) A new Author array is created of length of the old array + 1
      2) The Authors from the old array are copied into the new array
      3) The new Author is added in the last index of the new array
      4) The new array is returned
      Parameters:
      array - Representing the Author array
      item - Representing the Author to be added into the array
      Returns:
      Author [] Representing new array
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if array or item is null or the array length is less than 0

    • remove

      public static Author[] remove(Author[] array, int index)
      The remove method is passed the array and an index
      1) If the index is -1 or the array length is 0 then the original array is returned
      2) A new Author array is created of length of the old array - 1
      2) The Authors from the old array are copied into the new array except for the index that is being removed
      4) The new array is returned
      Parameters:
      array - Representing the Author array
      index - Representing the index to remove
      Returns:
      Author [] Representing new array
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if array or the array length is less than 0 or index is greater than or equal to the array length or index is less than -1
